content.content: In an effort to hit the ground running, on behalf of the nascent Immunefi Security CU, I want to invite some brainstorming on security topics that may be of interest to the Maker community. Here are some topics that we thought of,  private key management sim swapping device management social engineering 5 dollar wrench attack  What kind of questions would you like to have addressed by a security professional?
Josh Malware and Inadequate due diligence. And last but not least, insider threats.

flipflopflapdelegate:  Inadequate due diligence   For what specifically? I can imagine lots of places where we should exercise due diligence, for example, personnel hiring and collateral onboarding. Did you have a particular area in mind?     flipflopflapdelegate:  insider threats   Hm, what do you have in mind? Perhaps a new protocol engineering hire is a plant from Compound protocol trying to stealthily insert bugs into executive spells? Or do you imagine that an employee of google business services is leaking proprietary info that a Maker CU employee stored on a google drive?

psychonaut:  For what specifically? I can imagine lots of places where we should exercise due diligence, for example, personnel hiring and collateral onboarding.   Everything and anything related to MakerDAO, including but not limited to due diligence of this Forum, Discord, (both centralized), cybersecurity risk assessment for All CUs using multi-sigs (security ratings + best practices), metrics for mitigating CU team members risk (cyber attacks), educating the former, and that’s all I can think of right now…     psychonaut:  Hm, what do you have in mind? Perhaps a new protocol engineering hire is a plant from Compound protocol trying to stealthily insert bugs into executive spells? Or do you imagine that an employee of google business services is leaking proprietary info that a Maker CU employee stored on a google drive?   Yes, a new hire, or an NSA undercover CU team member, breakdown silos, etc. Thank you in advanced Josh! And always remember, Great Facilitators always channel their inner James Bond, their MacGyver, their Wonder Woman.

flipflopflapdelegate:  And always remember, Great Facilitators always channel their inner   Ha! I know you’re being jovial, I can’t let that go without a comment.      flipflopflapdelegate:  James Bond   Presumably, his bravery, ingenuity, and luck minus the blatant misogyny.     flipflopflapdelegate:  Wonder Woman   Not the horrid Marvel film? If you meant to reference Professor Marston & the Wonder Women then sure

This might be a good case study — looks like the team signed into a malicious frontend. How do we avoid our CU team members making this same mistake? @psychonaut via a Gnosis Safe Multi-sig    0xhabitat.substack.com    Team Funds Stolen and Multi-Sig Exploited Serious Update for all HBT token-holders      “I never sleep, because sleep is the cousin of death” —Nas

One for the list: the practice of regularly reviewing ERC20 allowances and deauthorizing what’s not strictly needed in the short term. Also setting up “prepaid” wallets with small amounts to move required authorizations to. So that the loss is limited to this separate wallet in case of a hack. Inspired by recent events :).   twitter.com    Julien Bouteloup - bneiluj.eth @bneiluj    🚨 Very urgent. 🚨   Go immediately to  etherscan.io/tokenapprovalc… and revoke approval to 0x1fcdb04d0c5364fbd92c73ca8af9baa72c269107 (hacker)  It exploits BadgerDAO. twitter.com/BadgerDAO/stat…   ₿adgerDAO 🦡 @BadgerDAO  Badger has received reports of unauthorized withdrawals of user funds.  As Badger engineers investigate this, all smart contracts have been paused to prevent further withdrawals.  Our investigation is ongoing and we will release further information as soon as possible.    11:19 AM - 2 Dec 2021           140                77

Looks like another front-end attack:   twitter.com    PeckShield Inc. @peckshield    Here is the list of funds that were so far transferred out from victims @BadgerDAO https://t.co/P5pOj1YQ2l   6:02 AM - 2 Dec 2021           170                43            BTW, when will this Forum be on a decentralized Cloud? Akash and Ceramic can’t come soon enough…

flipflopflapdelegate:  when will this Forum be on a decentralized Cloud? Akash and Ceramic can’t come soon enough   Infrastructure redundancy distributed among multiple cloud providers in different jurisdictions may be a more practical first step. But I agree that this one is becoming more of a priority every week.

Josh, how about best practices for CU teams to avoid frontends getting hacked? If your websites Cloudflare API key gets compromised, you might as well kiss that baby goodbye.    Cloudflare Community – 27 Sep 21    Someone else can create an account and API token on your email address This morning I saw someone created a Cloudfare account on my business address, logged in and created API tokens.  I used forgot my password to gain access, setup MFA, trash those API tokens and made sure my mailbox wasn’t compromised. It did give me...  Reading time: 1 mins 🕑 Likes: 2 ❤
Whoa! Maintaining pseudonymity is extremely difficult, but might serve as a topic for an advanced tutorial.
Josh—check out this Forta SDK for building “threat detection agents(scripts)”—wondering if Immunefi will be able to produce something similar for auditing & detecting bugs: FORTA
Looks like some work with Forta is already underway.
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
